src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Waves_in_pacifica_1.jpg/40px-Waves_in_pacifica_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="32" height="22" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Waves_in_pacifica_1.jpg/60px-Waves_in_pacifica_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Waves_in_pacifica_1.jpg/120px-Waves_in_pacifica_1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2000" data-file-height="1358" /></a></span></span><span class="portalbox-link"><a href="/wiki/Portal:Oceans" title="Portal:Oceans">Oceans portal</a></span></li><li class="portalbox-entry"><span class="portalbox-image"><span class="mw-image-border noviewer" typeof="mw:File"><span><img alt="flag" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" decoding="async" width="32" height="16" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/60px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/120px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600" /></span></span></span><span class="portalbox-link"><a href="/wiki/Portal:United_Kingdom" title="Portal:United Kingdom">United Kingdom portal</a></span></li></ul>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Titanic_conspiracy_theories" title="Titanic conspiracy theories"><i>Titanic</i> conspiracy theories</a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Titanic_in_popular_culture" title="Titanic in popular culture"><i>Titanic</i> in popular culture</a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Seamen%27s_Act" title="Seamen&#39;s Act">Seamen\'s Act</a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Lists_of_shipwrecks" title="Lists of shipwrecks">Lists of shipwrecks</a></li>\n<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Wreck_of_the_Titan:_Or,_Futility" title="The Wreck of the Titan: Or, Futility">The Wreck of the Titan: Or, Futility</a></i></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Comparable_disasters">Comparable disasters</h3></div>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/SS_Atlantic_(1870)" title="SS Atlantic (1870)">SS&#160;<i>Atlantic</i></a>, White Star Line ship lost in 1873 with the greatest loss of life for the company before <i>Titanic</i></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/RMS_Empress_of_Ireland" title="RMS Empress of Ireland">RMS&#160;<i>Empress of Ireland</i></a>, Canadian Pacific liner which was lost in 1914 due to collision with another ship</li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/SS_Eastland" title="SS Eastland">SS&#160;<i>Eastland</i></a>, a ship capsizing in 1915 after being fitted with extra lifeboats</li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/MS_Estonia" title="MS Estonia">MS&#160;<i>Estonia</i></a>, cruiseferry which sank due to poor design and extreme weather, causing the ship to breakup and allow sea water into the ship</li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Notes">Notes</h2></div>\n<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1239543626">.mw-parser-output .reflist{margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}@media screen{.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%}}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">\n<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">\n<li id="cite_note-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-14">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Carlisle would leave the project in 1910, before the ships were launched, when he became a shareholder in <a href="/wiki/Axel_Welin" title="Axel Welin">Welin Davit &amp; Engineering Company Ltd</a>, the firm making the ship\'s davits.<sup id="cite_ref-TIPCarlisle_12-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TIPCarlisle-12"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>12<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Wilding was sacked following the <i>Titanic</i> disaster, having been unfairly blamed by Pirrie for the ship\'s loss.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMcCluskie199820_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMcCluskie199820-13"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-21"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-21">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">It was kept off-limits to passengers; the famous "flying" scene at the ship\'s bow from the 1997 film <i>Titanic</i> would not have been permitted in real life.</span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-68"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-68">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Copy of the neoclassical oil painting by <a href="/wiki/Merry-Joseph_Blondel" title="Merry-Joseph Blondel">Merry-Joseph Blondel</a><sup id="cite_ref-New_York_Times_1913,_p._28_67-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-New_York_Times_1913,_p._28-67"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-75"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-75">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Measurement of lifeboats: <b>12:</b> 25\'2" long by 7\'2" wide by 3\'2" deep; 326.6 cubic feet (9.25&#160;m<sup>3</sup>); <b>316:</b> 30\' long by 9\'1" wide by 4\' deep; 655.2 cubic feet (18.55&#160;m<sup>3</sup>) and <b>AD:</b> 27\'5" long by 8\' wide by 3\' deep; 376.6 cubic feet (10.66&#160;m<sup>3</sup>) </span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-82"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-82">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Since 1894, when the largest passenger ship under consideration was the <a href="/wiki/Cunard_Line" title="Cunard Line">Cunard Line</a>\'s 13,000-tonne <a href="/wiki/RMS_Lucania" title="RMS Lucania"><i>Lucania</i></a>, the Board of Trade had made no provision to increase the existing scale regarding the number of required lifeboats for larger ships, such as the 46,000-tonne <i>Titanic</i>. Sir Alfred Chalmers, nautical adviser to the Board of Trade from 1896 to 1911, had considered the matter of adjusting the scale "from time to time", but because he not only assumed that experienced sailors would need to be carried "uselessly" aboard ship only to lower and man the extra lifeboats, but also anticipated the difficulty in getting away a greater number than 16 boats in any emergency, he "did not consider it necessary to increase [the scale]".<sup id="cite_ref-BritishInq_81-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BritishInq-81"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-119"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-119">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">He expressed deep disappointment about the decision before the voyage but was presumably greatly relieved afterwards.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGill2010241_118-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGill2010241-118"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>113<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-124"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-124">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><i>Titanic</i> also had a ship\'s cat, <a href="/wiki/Animals_aboard_the_Titanic#Jenny" title="Animals aboard the Titanic">Jenny</a>, who gave birth to a litter of kittens shortly before the ship\'s maiden voyage; all perished in the sinking.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGill2010246_123-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGill2010246-123"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>117<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-128"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-128">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Known afterward as the "Unsinkable Molly Brown" due to her efforts in helping other passengers while the ship sank.</span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-167"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-167">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Captain Edward Smith had been in command of <i>Titanic</i><span class="nowrap" style="padding-left:0.1em;">&#39;</span>s sister <i>Olympic</i> when she in 1911 collided with a warship. Even though that ship was designed to sink others by ramming them, it suffered greater damage than <i>Olympic</i>, thereby strengthening the image of the class being unsinkable.<sup id="cite_ref-titanico_165-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-titanico-165"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>157<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-166"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>158<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-171"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-171">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The official enquiry found that damage extended about 300 feet, but both Edward Wilding\'s testimony and modern <a href="/wiki/Ultrasound" title="Ultrasound">ultrasound</a> surveys of the <a href="/wiki/Wreck_of_the_RMS_Titanic" class="mw-redirect" title="Wreck of the RMS Titanic">wreck</a> suggest the total area was perhaps a few narrow openings totalling perhaps no more than 12 to 13 square feet (1.1 to 1.2&#160;m<sup>2</sup>).<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEReport1912question_20422,_Day_19_170-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEReport1912question_20422,_Day_19-170"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>161<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBroad1997_90-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBroad1997-90"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>85<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-175"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-175">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">An incident confirmed this philosophy while <i>Titanic</i> was under construction: the White Star liner <i>Republic</i> was involved in a collision and sank. Even though she did not have enough lifeboats for all passengers, they were all saved because the ship was able to stay afloat long enough for them to be ferried to ships coming to assist.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEChirnside200429_174-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEChirnside200429-174"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>164<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-203"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-203">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Salvation Army newspaper, <i>The War Cry</i>, reported that "none but a heart of stone would be unmoved in the presence of such anguish. Night and day that crowd of pale, anxious faces had been waiting patiently for the news that did not come. Nearly every one in the crowd had lost a relative."<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBartlett2011261_201-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBartlett2011261-201"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>190<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> It was not until 17 April that the first incomplete lists of survivors came through, delayed by poor communications.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBartlett2011262_202-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBartlett2011262-202"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>191<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-211"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-211">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">On 23 April, the <i>Daily Mail</i> reported: "Late in the afternoon hope died out. The waiting crowds thinned, and silent men and women sought their homes. In the humbler homes of Southampton there is scarcely a family who has not lost a relative or friend. Children returning from school appreciated something of tragedy, and woeful little faces were turned to the darkened, fatherless homes."<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEButler1998173_210-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEButler1998173-210"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>198<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-246"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-246">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"> Lord protested his innocence to the end of his life, and many researchers have asserted that the known positions of <i>Titanic</i> and <i>Californian</i> make it impossible that the former was the infamous "mystery ship", a topic which has "generated ... millions of words and ... hours of heated debates" and continues to do so.<sup id="cite_ref-245" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-245"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>232<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-263"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-263">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Most of the bodies were numbered; however, the five passengers <a href="/wiki/Burial_at_sea" title="Burial at sea">buried at sea</a> by <i>Carpathia</i> went unnumbered.<sup id="cite_ref-gov_ns_ca_bodies_262-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gov_ns_ca_bodies-262"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>248<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-268"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-268">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Thomson Beattie, a first class passenger, and two crew members, a fireman and a seaman.</span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-303"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-303">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">An example is Daniel Butler\'s book about RMS <i>Titanic</i>, titled <i>Unsinkable</i>.</span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-shiptime-340"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-shiptime_340-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-shiptime_340-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-shiptime_340-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-shiptime_340-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-shiptime_340-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Ship\'s time; at the time of the collision, <i>Titanic</i><span class="nowrap" style="padding-left:0.1em;">&#39;</span>s clocks were set to 2 hours 2 minutes ahead of <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Time_Zone" title="Eastern Time Zone">Eastern Time Zone</a> and 2 hours 58 minutes behind <a href="/wiki/Greenwich_Mean_Time" title="Greenwich Mean Time">Greenwich Mean Time</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHalpern201178_342-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHalpern201178-342"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>324<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>\n</li>\n</ol></div></div>\n<div class="mw-heading .mp-h2{background-color:#3d3d3d;border-color:#676767}}</style>\n<div id="mp-topbanner" class="mp-box">\n<div id="mp-welcomecount">\n<div id="mp-welcome"><div class="mw-heading mw-heading1"><h1 id="Welcome_to_Wikipedia">Welcome to <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia" title="Wikipedia">Wikipedia</a></h1></div>,</div>\n<div id="mp-free">the <a href="/wiki/Free_content" title="Free content">free</a> <a href="/wiki/Encyclopedia" title="Encyclopedia">encyclopedia</a> that <a href="/wiki/Help:Introduction_to_Wikipedia" title="Help:Introduction to Wikipedia">anyone can edit</a>.</div>\n<div id="articlecount"><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Special:Statistics" title="Special:Statistics">117,932</a> active editors</li> <li><a href="/wiki/Special:Statistics" title="Special:Statistics">6,989,450</a> articles in <a href="/wiki/English_language" title="English language">English</a></li></ul></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div id="mp-upper">\n<div id="mp-left" class="MainPageBG mp-box">\n<h2 id="mp-tfa-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">From today\'s featured article</h2>\n<div id="mp-tfa" class="mp-contains-float"><div id="mp-tfa-img" style="float: left; margin: 0.5em 0.9em 0.4em 0em;">\n<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 196px;">\n<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Rotterdam_feyenoord_stadion_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="De Kuip, venue of the 2015 KNVB Cup final"><img alt="De Kuip, venue of the 2015 KNVB Cup final" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Rotterdam_feyenoord_stadion_1.jpg/250px-Rotterdam_feyenoord_stadion_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="196" height="100" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Rotterdam_feyenoord_stadion_1.jpg/330px-Rotterdam_feyenoord_stadion_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Rotterdam_feyenoord_stadion_1.jpg/500px-Rotterdam_feyenoord_stadion_1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2800" data-file-height="1429" /></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">De Kuip, venue of the 2015 KNVB Cup final</div></div>\n</div>\n<p>The <b><a href="/wiki/2015_KNVB_Cup_final" title="2015 KNVB Cup final">2015 KNVB Cup final</a></b> was an <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">association football</a> match between <a href="/wiki/PEC_Zwolle" title="PEC Zwolle">PEC Zwolle</a> and <a href="/wiki/FC_Groningen" title="FC Groningen">FC Groningen</a> for the 97th <a href="/wiki/KNVB_Cup" title="KNVB Cup">KNVB Cup</a> final, the Dutch Cup competition, played on 3&#160;May 2015 at <a href="/wiki/De_Kuip" title="De Kuip">De Kuip</a> in <a href="/wiki/Rotterdam" title="Rotterdam">Rotterdam</a>. PEC, the defending champions after <a href="/wiki/2014_KNVB_Cup_final" title="2014 KNVB Cup final">their <span class="nowrap">51</span> victory</a> over <a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a> the previous year, were appearing in their fourth final. Groningen had reached the final once before, losing to <a href="/wiki/PSV_Eindhoven" title="PSV Eindhoven">PSV Eindhoven</a> in 1989. PEC and Groningen entered the competition in the second round and progressed through five rounds to reach the final. Groningen scored 22 goals en route, the most of any team during the qualifying rounds. In front of more than 46,000 spectators, the first half ended goalless. The Slovak <a href="/wiki/Albert_Rusn%C3%A1k_(footballer,_born_1994)" title="Albert Rusnk (footballer, born 1994)">Albert Rusnk</a> scored twice halfway through the second half, leading Groningen to a <span class="nowrap">20</span> victory and their first major honour. By winning the KNVB Cup, Groningen qualified for the <a href="/wiki/2015_Johan_Cruyff_Shield" title="2015 Johan Cruyff Shield">2015 Johan Cruyff Shield</a> and the <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_UEFA_Europa_League" title="201516 UEFA Europa League">201516 UEFA Europa League</a> group stage. (<b><a href="/wiki/2015_KNVB_Cup_final" title="2015 KNVB Cup final">Full&#160;article...</a></b>)\n</p>\n<div class="tfa-recent" style="text-align: right;">\nRecently featured: <style class="mp-contains-float">\n<div class="dyk-img" style="float: right; margin-left: 0.5em;">\n<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 116px;">\n<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Filodes_fulvidorsalis_lachryphagy.png" class="mw-file-description" title="Filodes fulvidorsalis drinking tears from a human eye"><img alt="Filodes fulvidorsalis drinking tears from a human eye" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Filodes_fulvidorsalis_lachryphagy.png/120px-Filodes_fulvidorsalis_lachryphagy.png" decoding="async" width="116" height="170" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Filodes_fulvidorsalis_lachryphagy.png/250px-Filodes_fulvidorsalis_lachryphagy.png 1.5x" data-file-width="781" data-file-height="1147" /></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;"><i><a href="/wiki/Filodes_fulvidorsalis" title="Filodes fulvidorsalis">Filodes fulvidorsalis</a></i> drinking tears from a human eye</div></div>\n</div>\n<ul><li>... that some insects <b><a href="/wiki/Lachryphagy" title="Lachryphagy">drink the tears</a></b> <i>(example pictured)</i> of their predators?</li>\n<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Vatican.va" title="Vatican.va">the Vatican\'s website</a></b> was first made available in <a href="/wiki/Latin" title="Latin">Latin</a> under <a href="/wiki/Pope_Benedict_XVI" title="Pope Benedict XVI">Pope Benedict&#160;XVI</a>?</li>\n<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Blue_Origin_NS-31" title="Blue Origin NS-31">Blue Origin <span class="nowrap">NS-31</span></a></b> recently became the first all-female spaceflight in 62 years?</li>\n<li>... that a disused industrial pier was incorporated into <b><a href="/wiki/Little_Squalicum_Park" title="Little Squalicum Park">a city park</a></b>?</li>\n<li>... that a <a href="/wiki/Cultivar" title="Cultivar">cultivar</a> of <i><b><a href="/wiki/Aquilegia_flabellata" title="Aquilegia flabellata">Aquilegia flabellata</a></b></i> has been called "as beautiful as a columbine needs to be"?</li>\n<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/George_R._Dale" title="George R. Dale">George R. Dale</a></b> was sent to prison by a judge whom he accused of being in the <a href="/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan" title="Ku Klux Klan">Ku Klux Klan</a>?</li>\n<li>... that the sled dog race <b><a href="/wiki/Ivakkak" title="Ivakkak">Ivakkak</a></b> features two mushers riding on the dog sled?</li>\n<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Major_League_Baseball" title="Major League Baseball">Major League Baseball</a>\'s first <b><a href="/wiki/Pride_Night" title="Pride Night">Pride Night</a></b> came about after a <a href="/wiki/Lesbian" title="Lesbian">lesbian</a> couple were removed from a <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles_Dodgers" title="Los Angeles Dodgers">Los Angeles Dodgers</a> game for kissing?</li>\n<li>... that people in parts of India, North America, and Africa marry <b><a href="/wiki/Trunk_(botany)" title="Trunk (botany)">tree trunks</a></b>?</li></ul>\n<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374" /><div class="hlist dyk-footer noprint" style="margin-top: 0.5em; text-align: right;">\n<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Recent_additions" title="Wikipedia:Recent additions">Archive</a></b></li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Help:Your_first_article" title="Help:Your first article">Start a new article</a></b></li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Did_you_know" title="Template talk:Did you know">Nominate an article</a></b></li></ul>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div id="mp-right" class="MainPageBG mp-box">\n<h2 id="mp-itn-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">In the news</h2>\n<div id="mp-itn" class="mp-contains-float"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1053378754">.mw-parser-output .itn-img{float:right;margin-left:0.5em;margin-top:0.2em}</style><div role="figure" class="itn-img">\n<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 121px;">\n<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Mark_Carney_portrait_February_2020.jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="Mark Carney in 2020"><img alt="Mark Carney in 2020" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/db/Mark_Carney_portrait_February_2020.jpg/250px-Mark_Carney_portrait_February_2020.jpg" decoding="async" width="121" height="161" class="mw-file-element" data-file-width="2875" data-file-height="3833" /></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word; text-align: left;">Mark Carney</div></div>\n</div>\n<ul><li>In Canada, the <a href="/wiki/Liberal_Party_of_Canada" title="Liberal Party of Canada">Liberal Party</a>, led by Prime Minister <a href="/wiki/Mark_Carney" title="Mark Carney">Mark Carney</a> <i>(pictured)</i>, wins the most seats in <b><a href="/wiki/2025_Canadian_federal_election" title="2025 Canadian federal election">the federal election</a></b>.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/2025_Iberian_Peninsula_blackout" title="2025 Iberian Peninsula blackout">A power outage</a></b> affects most of the <a href="/wiki/Iberian_Peninsula" title="Iberian Peninsula">Iberian Peninsula</a>.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Port_of_Shahid_Rajaee_explosion" title="Port of Shahid Rajaee explosion">An explosion and fire</a></b> at the <a href="/wiki/Port_of_Shahid_Rajaee" title="Port of Shahid Rajaee">Port of Shahid Rajaee</a>, Iran, kills at least 70 people and injures more than 1,200 others.</li>\n<li>At least 11 people are killed in <b><a href="/wiki/2025_Vancouver_car_attack" title="2025 Vancouver car attack">a car-ramming attack</a></b> at a street festival in <a href="/wiki/Vancouver" title="Vancouver">Vancouver</a>, Canada.</li>\n<li>Militants <b><a href="/wiki/2025_Pahalgam_attack" title="2025 Pahalgam attack">attack</a></b> a group of tourists in <a href="/wiki/Jammu_and_Kashmir_(union_territory)" title="Jammu and Kashmir (union territory)">Indian-administered Kashmir</a>, killing 26 people.</li></ul>\n<div class="itn-footer" style="margin-top: 0.5em;">\n<div><b><a href="/wiki/Portal:Current_events" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374" /><div class="hlist itn-footer noprint" style="text-align:right;">\n<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:In_the_news/Candidates" title="Wikipedia:In the news/Candidates">Nominate an article</a></b></li></ul>\n</div></div>\n<h2 id="mp-otd-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">On this day</h2>\n<div id="mp-otd" class="mp-contains-float">\n<p><b><a href="/wiki/May_3" title="May 3">May 3</a></b>: <b><a href="/wiki/World_Press_Freedom_Day" title="World Press Freedom Day">World Press Freedom Day</a></b>; <b><a href="/wiki/Constitution_Memorial_Day" title="Constitution Memorial Day">Constitution Memorial Day</a></b> in Japan (<a href="/wiki/1947" title="1947">1947</a>); <b><a href="/wiki/3_May_Constitution_Day" title="3 May Constitution Day">Constitution Day</a></b> in Poland (<a href="/wiki/1791" title="1791">1791</a>)\n</p>\n<div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-otd-img">\n<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 146px;">\n<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Benty_grange_helm_crop.png" class="mw-file-description" title="Benty Grange helmet"><img alt="Benty Grange helmet" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Benty_grange_helm_crop.png/250px-Benty_grange_helm_crop.png" decoding="async" width="146" height="134" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Benty_grange_helm_crop.png/330px-Benty_grange_helm_crop.png 2x" data-file-width="1517" data-file-height="1389" /></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Benty Grange helmet</div></div>\n</div>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/1481" title="1481">1481</a>  <b><a href="/wiki/1481_Rhodes_earthquake" title="1481 Rhodes earthquake">The largest of a series of earthquakes</a></b> struck the island of <a href="/wiki/Rhodes" title="Rhodes">Rhodes</a>, causing an estimated 30,000 casualties.</li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/1848" title="1848">1848</a>  The <b><a href="/wiki/Benty_Grange_helmet" title="Benty Grange helmet">Benty Grange helmet</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i>, a boar-crested <a href="/wiki/Anglo-Saxons" title="Anglo-Saxons">Anglo-Saxon</a> helmet similar to those mentioned in the contemporary epic poem <i><a href="/wiki/Beowulf" title="Beowulf">Beowulf</a></i>, was discovered in <a href="/wiki/Derbyshire" title="Derbyshire">Derbyshire</a>, England.</li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/1939" title="1939">1939</a>  <a href="/wiki/Subhas_Chandra_Bose" title="Subhas Chandra Bose">Subhas Chandra Bose</a> formed the <b><a href="/wiki/All_India_Forward_Bloc" title="All India Forward Bloc">All India Forward Bloc</a></b>, a faction within the <a href="/wiki/Indian_National_Congress" title="Indian National Congress">Indian National Congress</a>, in opposition to <a href="/wiki/Mahatma_Gandhi" title="Mahatma Gandhi">Gandhi</a>\'s tactics of <a href="/wiki/Nonviolent_resistance" title="Nonviolent resistance">nonviolence</a>.</li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/1999" title="1999">1999</a>  A <a href="/wiki/Doppler_on_Wheels" title="Doppler on Wheels">Doppler on Wheels</a> team measured the fastest winds recorded on Earth, at 143.6&#160;m/s (321&#160;mph; 517&#160;km/h), in <b><a href="/wiki/1999_Bridge_Creek%E2%80%93Moore_tornado" title="1999 Bridge CreekMoore tornado">a tornado</a></b> near <a href="/wiki/Bridge_Creek,_Oklahoma" title="Bridge Creek, Oklahoma">Bridge Creek, Oklahoma</a>.</li></ul>\n<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374" /><div class="hlist" style="margin-top: 0.5em;"><ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Elizabeth_Bacon_(died_1621)" title="Elizabeth Bacon (died 1621)">Elizabeth Bacon</a></b>  (<abbr title="died">d.</abbr>&#160;1621)</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Jacob_Riis" title="Jacob Riis">Jacob Riis</a></b>  (<abbr title="born">b.</abbr>&#160;1849)</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Bob_McCallister" title="Bob McCallister">Bob McCallister</a></b>  (<abbr title="born">b.</abbr>&#160;1934)</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Ron_Hextall" title="Ron Hextall">Ron Hextall</a></b>  (<abbr title="born">b.</abbr>&#160;1964)</li></ul></div>\n<div style="margin-top:0.5em;">\nMore anniversaries: <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374" /><div class="hlist inline nowraplinks">\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/May_2" title="May 2">May 2</a></li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/May_3" title="May 3">May 3</a></b></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/May_4" title="May 4">May 4</a></li></ul>\n</div></div>\n<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374" /><div class="hlist otd-footer noprint" style="text-align:right;">\n<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Selected_anniversaries/May" title="Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/May">Archive</a></b></li>\n<li><b><a anniversaries">About</a></b></li></ul>\n</div></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div id="mp-lower" class="MainPageBG mp-box">\n<h2 id="mp-tfp-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">Today\'s featured picture</h2>\n<div id="mp-tfp">\n<table role="presentation" style="margin:0 3px 3px; width:100%; box-sizing:border-box; text-align:center; border-collapse:collapse; padding:0.9em">\n<tbody><tr>\n<td><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Eastern_grey_kangaroo_(Macropus_giganteus)_Mount_Annan_composite_of_6.jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="Eastern grey kangaroo"><img alt="Eastern grey kangaroo" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Eastern_grey_kangaroo_%28Macropus_giganteus%29_Mount_Annan_composite_of_6.jpg/960px-Eastern_grey_kangaroo_%28Macropus_giganteus%29_Mount_Annan_composite_of_6.jpg" decoding="async" width="600" height="136" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Eastern_grey_kangaroo_%28Macropus_giganteus%29_Mount_Annan_composite_of_6.jpg/1200px-Eastern_grey_kangaroo_%28Macropus_giganteus%29_Mount_Annan_composite_of_6.jpg 2x" data-file-width="15168" data-file-height="3437" /></a></span>\n</td></tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="padding:0 0.9em; text-align:left;">\n<p>The <b><a href="/wiki/Eastern_grey_kangaroo" title="Eastern grey kangaroo">eastern grey kangaroo</a></b> (<i>Macropus giganteus</i>) is a <a href="/wiki/Marsupial" title="Marsupial">marsupial</a> found in the eastern third of Australia, with a population of several million. The eastern grey kangaroo is the second largest living marsupial and native land mammal in Australia, with adult males weighing around 50 to 66&#160;kg (110 to 146&#160;lb) and females weighing around 17 to 40&#160;kg (37 to 88&#160;lb). Like all <a href="/wiki/Kangaroo" title="Kangaroo">kangaroos</a>, it is mainly <a href="/wiki/Nocturnality" title="Nocturnality">nocturnal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Crepuscular_animal" title="Crepuscular animal">crepuscular</a>, and is mostly seen early in the morning, or as the light starts to fade in the evening. In the middle of the day, kangaroos rest in the cover of the woodlands and <a href="/wiki/Grazing_(behaviour)" title="Grazing (behaviour)">graze</a> there. Kangaroos are the only large mammals to <a href="/wiki/Jumping" title="Jumping">hop</a> on two legs as their primary means of <a href="/wiki/Animal_locomotion" title="Animal locomotion">locomotion</a>.  This <a href="/wiki/Multiple_exposure" title="Multiple exposure">multiple exposure</a> photograph shows an eastern grey kangaroo hopping in <a href="/wiki/Mount_Annan,_New_South_Wales" title="Mount Annan, New South Wales">Mount Annan, New South Wales</a>.\n</p>\n<p style="text-align:center;"><small>Photograph credit: <a href="/wiki/User:Charlesjsharp" title="User:Charlesjsharp">Charles J. Sharp</a></small></p>\n<div class="potd-recent" style="text-align:right;">\nRecently featured: <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374" /><div class="hlist inline">\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Template:POTD/2025-05-02" title="Template:POTD/2025-05-02"><i>Raising a Flag over the Reichstag</i></a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Template:POTD/2025-05-01" title="Template:POTD/2025-05-01">Euthrix potatoria</a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Template:POTD/2025-04-30" title="Template:POTD/2025-04-30">Mimetite</a></li></ul>\n</div></div>\n<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374" /><div class="hlist potd-footer noprint" style="text-align:right;">\n<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Picture_of_the_day/Archive" title="Wikipedia:Picture of the day/Archive">Archive</a></b></li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Featured_pictures" title="Wikipedia:Featured pictures">More featured pictures</a></b></li></ul>\n</div>\n</td></tr></tbody></table></div>\n</div>\n<div id="mp-bottom" class="mp-box">\n<h2 id="mp-other" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">Other areas of Wikipedia</h2>\n<div id="mp-other-content">\n<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Community_portal" title="Wikipedia:Community portal">Community portal</a></b>  The central hub for editors, with resources, links, tasks, and announcements.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump" title="Wikipedia:Village pump">Village pump</a></b>  Forum for discussions about Wikipedia itself, including policies and technical issues.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:News" title="Wikipedia:News">Site news</a></b>  Sources of news about Wikipedia and the broader Wikimedia movement.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Teahouse" title="Wikipedia:Teahouse">Teahouse</a></b>  Ask basic questions about using or editing Wikipedia.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Help_desk" title="Wikipedia:Help desk">Help desk</a></b>  Ask questions about using or editing Wikipedia.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Reference_desk" title="Wikipedia:Reference desk">Reference desk</a></b>  Ask research questions about encyclopedic topics.</li>\n<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Portals" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Portals">Content portals</a></b>  A unique way to navigate the encyclopedia.</li></ul>\n</div>\n<h2 id="mp-sister" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">Wikipedia\'s sister projects</h2>\n<div id="mp-sister-content"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1239335380">.mw-parser-output #sister-projects-list{display:flex;flex-wrap:wrap}.mw-parser-output #sister-projects-list li{display:inline-block}.mw-parser-output #sister-projects-list li span{font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output #sister-projects-list li>div{display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle;padding:6px 4px}.mw-parser-output #sister-projects-list li>div:first-child{text-align:center}@media screen{.mw-parser-output .sister-projects-wikt-icon-dark,html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output .sister-projects-wikt-icon-light{display:none}html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output .sister-projects-wikt-icon-dark{display:inline}}@media screen and (prefers-color-scheme:dark){html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .mw-parser-output .sister-projects-wikt-icon-dark{display:inline}html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .mw-parser-output .sister-projects-wikt-icon-light{display:none}}@media(min-width:360px){.mw-parser-output #sister-projects-list li{width:33%;min-width:20em;white-space:nowrap;flex:1 0 25%}.mw-parser-output #sister-projects-list li>div:first-child{min-width:50px}}</style>\n<p>Wikipedia is written by volunteer editors and hosted by the <a href="/wiki/Wikimedia_Foundation" title="Wikimedia Foundation">Wikimedia Foundation</a>, a non-profit organization that also hosts a range of other volunteer <a href="https://wikimediafoundation.org/our-work/wikimedia-projects/" class="extiw" title="foundationsite:our-work/wikimedia-projects/">projects</a>:\n</p>\n<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1126788409">.mw-parser-output .plainlist ol,.mw-parser-output .plainlist ul{line-height:inherit;list-style:none;margin:0;padding:0}.mw-parser-output .plainlist ol li,.mw-parser-output .plainlist ul li{margin-bottom:0}</style><div class="plainlist">\n<ul id="sister-projects-list">\n<li>\n  <div><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/" mw-html-heading">Wikipedia languages</h2>\n<div><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r997272951">.mw-parser-output .wikipedia-languages-complete{font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .wikipedia-languages ul{margin-left:0}.mw-parser-output .wikipedia-languages ul a{white-space:nowrap}.mw-parser-output .wikipedia-languages>ul{list-style:none;text-align:center;clear:both}.mw-parser-output .wikipedia-languages-count-container{width:90%;display:flex;justify-content:center;padding-top:1em;margin:0 auto}.mw-parser-output .wikipedia-languages-prettybars{width:100%;height:1px;margin:0.5em 0;background-color:#c8ccd1;flex-shrink:1;align-self:center}.mw-parser-output .wikipedia-languages-count{padding:0 1em;white-space:nowrap}</style>\n<div class="wikipedia-languages nourlexpansion">\n<p>This Wikipedia is written in <a href="/wiki/English_language" title="English language">English</a>. Many <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/List_of_Wikipedias" class="extiw" title="meta:List of Wikipedias">other Wikipedias are available</a>; some of the largest are listed below.\n</p>\n<ul If you don\'t know exactly what you are looking for or wish to explore broad areas, click on a link in the header menu at the top of this page, or begin your browsing below:\n</p>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2 ext-discussiontools-init-section"><h2 id="Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects" data-mw-thread-id="h-Navigating_Wikipedia&#39;s_subjects"><span id="Navigating_Wikipedia.27s_subjects"></span><span data-mw-comment-start="" id="h-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects"></span>Navigating Wikipedia\'s subjects<span data-mw-comment-end="h-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects"></span></h2><!--__DTELLIPSISBUTTON__{"threadItem":{"headingLevel":2,"name":"h-","type":"heading","level":0,"id":"h-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","replies":["h-Culture-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Geography-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Health-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-History-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Human_activities-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Mathematics_and_formal_sciences-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Natural_sciences-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-People-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Philosophy-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Reference_works-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Religion-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Society_and_social_sciences-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects","h-Technology_and_applied_sciences-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects"],"uneditableSection":true}}--></div>\n<p>Wikipedia organizes its content into distinct subject classifications, each with further subdivisions.\n</p>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Culture" data-mw-thread-id="h-Culture-Navigating_Wikipedia&#39;s_subjects"><span data-mw-comment-start="" id="h-Culture-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects"></span>Culture<span id="h-Bibliographies-Reference_works"></span>Bibliographies<span data-mw-comment-end="h-Bibliographies-Reference_works"></span></h4></div>\n<p>Access sources on specific topics for further reading or verification.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:List_of_bibliographies" title="Wikipedia:List of bibliographies">Wikipedia:List of bibliographies</a>  Compilation of bibliographies</li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Category:Wikipedia_bibliographies" title="Category:Wikipedia bibliographies">Category:Wikipedia bibliographies</a>  Multi-page catalog of Wikipedia\'s bibliographies</li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Religion" data-mw-thread-id="h-Religion-Navigating_Wikipedia&#39;s_subjects"><span data-mw-comment-start="" ethics, and more.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Religion_and_belief_systems" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Religion and belief systems">Religion</a></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading data-mw-comment-end="h-Society_and_social_sciences-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects"></span></h3></div>\n<p>Understand collectives, social interactions, political authority, and cultural norms.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Society_and_social_sciences" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Society and social sciences">Society</a></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading data-mw-comment-end="h-Technology_and_applied_sciences-Navigating_Wikipedia\'s_subjects"></span></h3></div>\n<p>Learn about techniques, skills, methods, and processes in technology and science.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Technology_and_applied_sciences" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Technology and applied sciences">Technology</a></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading id="Wikipedia.27s_main_content_systems"></span><span data-mw-comment-start="" id="h-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems"></span>Wikipedia\'s main content systems<span data-mw-comment-end="h-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems"></span></h2><!--__DTELLIPSISBUTTON__{"threadItem":{"headingLevel":2,"name":"h-","type":"heading","level":0,"id":"h-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems","replies":["h-Overview_articles-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems","h-Outline_pages-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems","h-List_pages-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems","h-Portals-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems","h-Glossaries-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems","h-Category_system-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems"],"uneditableSection":true}}--></div>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Overview_articles" data-mw-thread-id="h-Overview_articles-Wikipedia&#39;s_main_content_systems"><span data-mw-comment-start="" id="h-Overview_articles-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems"></span>Overview articles<span data-mw-comment-end="h-Overview_articles-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems"></span></h3></div>\n<p>Get summaries of broad topics with links to subtopics, biographies, and related articles.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Overviews" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Overviews">Overview articles</a></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Outline_pages" data-mw-thread-id="h-Outline_pages-Wikipedia&#39;s_main_content_systems"><span data-mw-comment-start="" outline format, linking to more detailed articles.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Outlines" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Outlines">Outline pages</a></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading pages<span data-mw-comment-end="h-List_pages-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems"></span></h3></div>\n<p>Find enumerations of specific types, such as lists of countries and people.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Lists" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Lists">List pages</a></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Portals" data-mw-comment-end="h-Portals-Wikipedia\'s_main_content_systems"></span></h3></div>\n<p>Access featured articles, images, news, and more through thematic portals.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Portals" title="Wikipedia:Contents/Portals">Portals</a></li></ul>\n<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Glossaries" class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Vital_articles" data-mw-thread-id="h-Vital_articles-Articles_by_importance_or_quality"><span data-mw-comment-start="" demand high-quality articles, grouped by importance.\n</p>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Vital_articles" title="Wikipedia:Vital articles">Vital articles</a></li>\n<li><a
